{"step_by_step_thinking": "The carotid sinus is a dilated area at the base of the internal carotid artery. It is the major baroreception site in humans and most mammals. The carotid sinus contains baroreceptors which monitor blood pressure. Therefore, the carotid sinus/baroreceptor is located at the origin of the internal carotid artery.", "answer_choice": "B"}
